cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northward across the central Gulf, then accelerate N-NE making landfall on the northern Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi) late Wednesday before racing northeast across AL/GA and the southern Appalachians
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast from Morgan City, LA to the MS/AL border (near southeast Louisiana–Mississippi coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, Louisiana to the MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton Co. line, FL; Storm-Surge Warning Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-FL Panhandle) then inland across MS, AL, GA, the southern Appalachians and Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely occasional gusts 25-35 mph Thursday as the weakening system passes inland to the northwest
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Thursday, locally higher in bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out across southern Georgia on Thursday, but overall risk at the port remains low
